To the chief Musician<S>5329</S>, A Psalm of David<S>1732</S>, to bring to remembrance<S>2142</S>. Make haste, O God<S>430</S>, to deliver<S>5337</S> me; make haste<S>2363</S> to help<S>5833</S> me, O LORD<S>3068</S>. <sup>to help: Heb. to my help</sup>
Let them be ashamed<S>954</S> and confounded<S>2659</S> that seek<S>1245</S> after my soul<S>5315</S>: let them be turned<S>5472</S> backward<S>268</S>, and put to confusion<S>3637</S>, that desire<S>2655</S> my hurt<S>7451</S>.
Let them be turned back<S>7725</S> for a reward<S>6118</S> of their shame<S>1322</S> that say<S>559</S>, Aha<S>1889</S>, aha<S>1889</S>.
Let all those that seek<S>1245</S> thee rejoice<S>7797</S> and be glad<S>8055</S> in thee: and let such as love<S>157</S> thy salvation<S>3444</S> say<S>559</S> continually<S>8548</S>, Let God<S>430</S> be magnified<S>1431</S>.
But I am poor<S>6041</S> and needy<S>34</S>: make haste<S>2363</S> unto me, O God<S>430</S>: thou art my help<S>5828</S> and my deliverer<S>6403</S>; O LORD<S>3068</S>, make no tarrying<S>309</S>.
